name: xenon and krypton purification, air separation | krypton, gaseous | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9413/documentation

The process describes the production of pure xenon and krypton deriven from a crude concentrate from a cryogenic air separation process. As products only gaseous xenon and gaseous krypton were considered. Oxygen that is used as carrier material and returned to the air separation process is not considered.



Xenon, krypron as ressource, Electricity for process, cooling water and waste heat. Estimation for process infrastructure .
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data from an producer in europe. Further data from a study from New Zealand.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Kr-Xe-concentrate with 99.7% O2 is obtained from a side column of large air separation plants. Processes as purification and further distillation and the achieved yield may vary. Data represents an average process.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Energy data represent an average process. Cooling water demand extrapolated from the assumed technology with cooling tower. Infrastructure represents only a rougth estimate.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Production amount world-wide about 30-40 t/a for xenon and 300-400 t/a for krypton. Amount of production represented in Europe is not known.
